class ActorBase

Detailed Description

This class is used by the actor class to sync between the physics world and the graphical world.

This class provides the link for position and orientation between the two worlds in the engine. This is called on every step(frame) of the world to sync the actor if it has moved.

Member Function Documentation

void PhysMotionState::getWorldTransform ( btTransform &  worldTrans  )  const [virtual]

Sets the initial position.

This function is called on by the physics world upon adding the actor to the world. This function uses the previous set vector3 that was set with SetInitPosition().
Default position is (0,0,0).

Parameters:
WorldTrans The location and orientation data.

void PhysMotionState::SetOrientation ( PhysQuaternion  orientation  ) 

Sets the initial orientation.

Sets the orientation the actor will have when it is added to the world. This function is called on by the ActorBase function SetInitOrientation().

Parameters:
Orientation The vector3 representing the orientation to be used.

void PhysMotionState::SetPosition ( PhysVector3  position  ) 

Sets the initial position.

Sets the position the actor will be placed in when it is added to the world. This function is called on by the ActorBase function SetInitPosition().
